intro: Chaetanthera pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in dry conditions.
